Posts.Content: Klawless9 wrote: HI there I had a bi-lateral mastectomy with reconstruction on nov 4th. I'm 34. Saw my surgeon last night and he told me that he removed 3 nodes that at the time looked good, upon further review they found that 2 had micro metastases, 1 didn't. He also said my tumor was 3cm (making it stage 2b). He gave me number to an oncologist and said that most likely this person will suggest chemo just on the strength of my age and the size of the tumor. My breast surgeon said he is on the fence as to what i should do (remove all nodes or chemo or what) because the cancer cells were so tiny and only in the 2. Oh and i'm BRCA negative. My mom had BC when she was 46, same boob as me and had a mastectomy (no chemo or anything). She's 70 now and never had any problems after.   i got an appt for dec. 1st with the onc.  any advice/suggestions on my situation, what to ask the oncologist, anything? thanks Kendall  Dx 8/20/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, 2/22 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: just got sucky news Klawless9 sadmom

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2009 01:16PM Klawless9 wrote: Due to being thrown off last night with the news, I forgot to get a copy of the BS path report. Will call tomorrow to get it. And if I turn down the chemo? I'm seeing a doc at medical oncology associates of long island. Ever heard of them?
Posts.Title: just got sucky news Klawless9 sadmom

Posts.Content: Klawless9 wrote: long story short....i'm 34, have a family history of BC. i went for my very first mammo and ultrasound on tuesday and mentioned that about 2-3 weeks ago i felt a lump (mind you had made this appointment back in April). I assumed it was due to being pre-menstrual.  they did mammo and ultrasound and a doc looked at ny utrasoud and said "i'm concerned it may be early breat cancer, you need a needle biopsy". So here on my 1st experience i ended up having a needle biopsy and i'm terrified of needles. today the doc who did the needle biopsy called me at 2:02pm and said it was benign but still looked suspicious but that "they can look odd but still be benign and this is how you are" At 2:51pm she called me back and said that the lab was looking at the wrong papers and that my lump is malignant. she called it invasive ductal carcinoma.  she told me to call my primary doc who referred me for the tests and get a hold of a breast surgeon.  i'm livid now and pissed and scared.  i called my doc's office and was told that she never should have called me with any results, good or bad, that when a lab sees cancer they call the patients doctor and send everything to the doctor who then calls the patient.  my doc's office had not recieved any info from them at that time. I am going tomorrow to see what's up. i'm praying and staying positive that the first result of benign is still right but if its not, i'm scared to death to go through treatment. i have no idea what goes on, i've never been hospitalized for anything.  someone told me to go prepared with questions and a note pad. can anyone tell me what to ask, anything...i have no real question for you guys...i just want to hear back from anyone with advice, suggestions, knowledge, wisdom...all of the above.  :) Thanks a lot Kendall Dx 8/20/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, 2/22 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2009 12:59AM Klawless9 wrote: Ok so here we go: Genetic test results-negative, no mutation. Good news! So this means my chances of developing a second cancer in the other breast or ovarian is 5%, if I was positive for the mutation it would be 66%. Also, if I were positive for the mutation I would pass it on to my future children. So I don't have to worry about that. Breast MRI-no funny business in the infected boob except for what we already know about. Nothing in the healthy breast and nothing showed up in the lymph nodes although he will still be checking them during surgery (sentinel node biopsy). Tentative dates for surgery-November 2 or 5, depends on when plastic surgeon comes back from vacation which I will find out today hopefully. I'm still going to go ahead with the bi-lateral mastectomy and reconstruction because if I remove the infected boob and reconstruct it, the plastic surgeon will not enhance the healthy one until the infected boob is finished, so it would call for me to go back into surgery later on down the road for the healthy boob. Also, these boobies and I have always had a love/hate relationship and after all this stress, I feel like I want something good to come out of it...like a B cup! take care ladies! Kendall

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2009 07:32AM Klawless9 wrote: what does grade mean? I made a friend where i went for my pre-admission testing and i had to call her today because 'm trying to make an appointment at Slaon Kettering hospital but i need to first fax some things one of which being my most recent blood work. so i called my friend and she printed out my info for me. one of the things printed out was the surgical pathology report that this surgeon had his hospital do that i requested from his office and haven't gotten yet (God works in mysterious ways). anyway, it says a few things but stuff that stands out are "approximately 9mm in size" (that doesn't sound too big...i guess  also "infiltrating moderately differentiated ductal carcinoma. focal ductal carcinoma in situ, solid type, intermediate nuclear grade. Comment: the tumor shows few tubules, intermediate nuclei adn a low mitotic rate consistent with a modified Bloom Richardson histologic score of 6, grade 2".    Now i have to research that crap...although i won't do it tonight...i've been ordered to lay off the BC book reading and website searching for at least one night!

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2009 04:22AM Klawless9 wrote: ok girls....here we go again...today i met with the 3rd and final doctor, Dr. David Kaufman (has a website, breastcarespecialist.com...someone recommended him to me). he takes my insurance, liked him, office staff very nice as well. he said the same as teh lady i saw yesterday who doesn't take ANY insurance. here are my options: 1-lumpectomy with possible loss of nipple (depending on if tumor is attached to it, he said the MRI i have tomorrow will tell a lot)  2-lumpectomy, lose nipple, reconstruct one later 3-mastectomy, no reconstruct 4-mastectomy, reconstruct (as well as option of doing both boobies) Tomorrow is the breast MRI, Friday i am taking BRCA test. How the hell do i make a decision?  he gave me number of plastic surgeon he works with, i'm gonna call him and make an appt. so that i can find out EXACTLY how this reconstruction shit is done. If i do that, i'm not trying to get some big boobies, at most a small B maybe or a full A since i never filled out an A cup bra. Again though, how the hell do i decide? he said he prefers to wait to get BRCA results before scheduling surgery and BRCA comes back in 2 weeks. He said lumpectomy and mastectomy with no reconstruct will be same day. With reconstruct would be 1-2 day hospital stay.  The least amount of days stay for me the better! i have hospital phobia anyway. the white walls and the smell get my heart racing. so input ladies...i need input love ya kendall

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2009 01:29AM Klawless9 wrote: Hi everyone I'm laying here in the hospital waiting for my family to pick me up! Surgery went well yesterday. Think my sis said it was a little over 3 hours. Last thing I remember was anesthesia guy saying "first I'll give u something to relax you" and that was it. I never saw him put the mask on my face! Hahaha I was cool, calm and collected before the procedure. The worse part for me was the sentinel node injections! OMG! My family told me the doc said it went well and no nodes were positive. Guess I just wait for pathology now. Plastic surgeon came to see me this morning and said I look good. He said I'm tight and he only put enough saline in expander to keep it wet cuz he didn't want me to be too tight. I've been doing percocet every 4 hours so feeling no pain, just a little discomfort. Thanks for ur prayers and thoughts. Gotta go now! Love you all

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2009 08:12AM Klawless9 wrote: ok here we go: today i met with Dr. Maurer. She was very nice and very informative. I told her how i was to get a lumpectomy and then the doc told me i couldn't and my only option was mastectomy. she said that i always have an option and then proceeded to draw on my booby with a pen. she said that she understood why he said mastectomy because i would lose my nipple with a lumpectomy. but she said that she could do it and have a plastic surgeon there to see how much they can save of the nipple and if none can be saved he can reconstruct a nipple.  she also told me that of course, once the lumpectomy was done i'd need 6 weeks radiation/5 days a week. she explained the need for clear margins and the fact that if we didn't get clear margins, a mastectomy with or without reconstruction would be the next step. she then was surprised i hadn't had a breast mri yet and said that i need that first before and bone scans or cat scans. her scheduler made appts for me for genetic counseling and breast mri for wednesday and a consult with the radiation oncologist for tomorrow. tomorrow i am still keeping my appt with the 3rd doc and will use him as the tie breaker. i liked her but she doesn't take insurance as i told you gals. i meet with her again next week and will ask her about that stuff then. i was so overwhelmed and impressed by all the info she was giving me and how intense she was with getting my history (i loved that) that my mom and i didn't get into money yet. now i have to look up the breast MRI process since i'm a nervous nelly about these things :)   another thing that impressed me was that i initially was given an appt to see her for wednesday. but then the office chick called me back and said dr. maurer wanted to see me Monday. immediately i thought the worse. today she told me that she was on vacation last week and her receptionist called her to let her know she'd be meeting with a new patient on wednesday and gave her some background on me. she said she hung up and thought about it and called the girl back and said "bring her in on monday, i feel like she's on the wrong path and i need to get her on the right one". talk about giving someone goosebumps!
Posts.Title: recieved 2 different diagnoses today... Klawless9 swest

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2009 07:23AM Klawless9 wrote: Hi everyone so i made it through the breast MRI, i'm such a baby! the IV part is what was scaring me. i never had an IV before so after she put it in i was afraid to bend my arm. i walked out with my arm straight out in front me. another lady asked me if i was ok and i said "yeah i'm just afraid to bend my arm" she says "don't be afraid" and then bends my arm! LOL i had ear plugs but that thing is LOUD! i told them people probably leave with a headache because it sounds like a really bad rock band! LOL so i wait for that. friday is more sticking with a needle for genetic testing. i think i will call doctor #1's office and tell them i won't be using him. I have to MAN UP! LOL i wish i could bring all of you to my appt's because you bring up such good questions and give such good info! luv ya kendall

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2009 09:28PM Klawless9 wrote: thank you! well my doctor explained that what could have happened is that the pathologist saw good cells and then a bad one. we're not sure on the report it first says b9 and then invasive ductal C. my doctor's feeling is that she wants it out whatever it is and wants me to get in to the breast surgeon soon. i googled him and he has a website that says if there is availability he takes same day or next day appointments so hopefully he can see me monday or tuesday.  my doc informed me that it does not necessarily mean that the whole lump is cancer, it could be a few cells but that they find that out when they take it out.  my thing is that whatever it is, i don't want chemo! that scares the hell out of me! plus i'm so damn petite (between us gals...i'm not even 90 pounds) i'm afraid that stuff will take everything outta me or something. i printed out the questions to ask the surgeon just now as well as the what to expect with surgery article. i will be going to barnes and noble tomorrow to get the susan love book recommended.

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2009 07:01PM Klawless9 wrote: Ok this is how he explained it to me. Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2009 09:07AM Klawless9 wrote: Maria...you are the best! You are on the case! I'm going to call him tomorrow and hope he takes oxford/liberty. i've seen info on "one step (or one stage) immediate breast reconstruction" where doc puts in an implant right after surgeon removes breast. Actually read an article where doctors found it worked well on thin, small breasted women. I wonder if anyone has tried this? i can't find any info on it on the discussion board.  this is article I saw:  One-stage immediate breast reconstruction with implant following skin-sparing mastectomy in Asian patients. Wang HY, Ali RS, Chen SC, Chao TC, Cheng MH. Department of Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery, Chang Gung University, Tao Yuan, Taiwan. The Asian breast reconstruction patient is usually of lower mean age, lower body mass index (BMI), and has relatively small breasts. This study aimed to investigate the outcome of 1-stage immediate breast reconstruction using saline-filled implants in the Asian patients.Between April 2002 and July 2005, 30 patients underwent skin-sparing mastectomy and 1-stage immediate breast reconstruction with a saline-filled implant. Mean age was 42.9 years, with a mean BMI of 21.9 and a mean implant volume of 283 mL.The overall success rate was 96.6%, with 1 case of implant exposure secondary to chest skin necrosis. At mean follow-up of 21.5 months (range 6 to 40 months), 1 patient developed local recurrence (3.33%).Perfusion of the chest skin flap is reliable enough to allow 1-stage breast reconstruction with small saline-filled breast implants. We present this as an additional option for immediate breast reconstruction in thin women with small breasts. PMID: 18362560 [PubMed - indexed for MEDLINE]
Posts.Title: recieved 2 different diagnoses today... Klawless9 swest

Posts.Content: Klawless9 wrote: long story short....i'm 34, have a family history of BC. i went for my very first mammo and ultrasound on tuesday and mentioned that about 2-3 weeks ago i felt a lump (mind you had made this appointment back in April). I assumed it was due to being pre-menstrual.  they did mammo and ultrasound and a doc looked at ny utrasoud and said "i'm concerned it may be early breat cancer, you need a needle biopsy". So here on my 1st experience i ended up having a needle biopsy and i'm terrified of needles. today the doc who did the needle biopsy called me at 2:02pm and said it was benign but still looked suspicious but that "they can look odd but still be benign and this is how you are" At 2:51pm she called me back and said that the lab was looking at the wrong papers and that my lump is malignant. she called it invasive ductal carcinoma.  she told me to call my primary doc who referred me for the tests and get a hold of a breast surgeon.  i'm livid now and pissed and scared.  i called my doc's office and was told that she never should have called me with any results, good or bad, that when a lab sees cancer they call the patients doctor and send everything to the doctor who then calls the patient.  my doc's office had not recieved any info from them at that time. I am going tomorrow to see what's up. i'm praying and staying positive that the first result of benign is still right but if its not, i'm scared to death to go through treatment. i have no idea what goes on, i've never been hospitalized for anything.  someone told me to go prepared with questions and a note pad. can anyone tell me what to ask, anything...i have no real question for you guys...i just want to hear back from anyone with advice, suggestions, knowledge, wisdom...all of the above.  :) Thanks a lot Kendall Dx 8/20/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, 2/22 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: recieved 2 different diagnoses today... Klawless9 swest

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2009 12:10AM Klawless9 wrote: hi ladies  new update...i met with a PS last night. The good news is that he does immediate reconstruction with implants (direct to implant, one step...all those damn names), the bad news is that due to my being so damn petite (i'm only 5'2", 80lbs, lost a few pounds...well only 4 LOL), he said the skin the surgeon will be removing will be a significant loss on me therefore he's concerned i won'thave enough skin to hold an implant and he does not want me to be tight. SO...he showed me the expander most women get but the smallest size it comes in is too big for me, would go all into my underarm. Then he showed me one that comes small enough for me that is an expander/implant because it can be left in after desired size is reached if woman wants to and doesn't mind having saline implants. Otherwise, it works like an expander with weekly fills and can be replaced with a silicone implant. he said that looking at me he thinks a 100cc implant would give me a full A, therefore he thinks that on me every 100cc's will increase me by a cup size, I forget the number he said the typically fills other women to a cup size increase but its more than that. naturally he said the length of time will depend on how i tolerate the filling process. He likes to start off with small amounts of fill and if i tell him to put more to see if i can handle it he will. he explained that some women tell him to put 50 or more cc's and if they are uncomfortable for 2-3 days they come back to him and he removes some, he said that you want to be comfortable during the process. He showed me pictures and they were really good. hmmm what else...oh he said fills would start about 3 weeks after the surgery to give me time to get rid of drains and heal a bit.  i've been talking to my body telling it, "now listen, this is gonna be smooth sailing. don't give any problems. heal quickly, so we can keep it moving. I have things to do and people to see" LMAO My girlfriends said that after this whole process is over, they will throw me an "Unveiling of the Boobies" party! LOL I definitely may take up weekly wine drinking and become a wineaux (that's the classy version of the wine-o) Kendall
Posts.Title: recieved 2 different diagnoses today... Klawless9 swest

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2009 05:54PM Klawless9 wrote: Hello everyone!  First of all i want to thank each and every one of you for  your words of support and your love!  I just came in from my doctor and I have the copy of what i guess is the report. Its 4 pages. this is what each page says: page 1- at the top it says "Benign-fibrocytic changes of breast and cysts with apocrine metaplasia. pathology findings are not felt to be consistent witht eh suspicious imaging findings. excision is advised". At the bottom is the correction and that says "the pathologist phoned to indicate that there was an error in the original report. correct diagnosis is invasive ductal carcinoma, mri is recommended as well as excision"  Page 2-this is regarding the ultrasound guided large core needle biopsy and this says a whole lot of crap including, "an Inrad clip was placed"   page 3-is the bilateral mammo with CAD: says that the breast tissue is very dense, there is a grouping of 3-4 microcalcifications...no skin thickening or nipple retraction... page 4-bilateral ultrasound:there is a 12x13 mm irregular solid nodule. no other cysts or solid lesions are identified. small benign appearing lymph nodes are seen in both axillary regions"  so there you go....i was given the name of a breast surgeon to go to. i called but they are closed until monday so i left a message to make an appointment.  ideally i would like to get an appt. for monday or tuesday to get the ball rolling because months ago i planned a trip to Los Angeles for aug 26-30. what is the consensus about my trip?  i live in NY on Long Island any of you ladies from there?  Hugs! Kendall i must post a picture of myself...wait until you see me...i look 10! LOL

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2009 08:22PM Klawless9 wrote: so today i went for pre-admission testing and got other information for monday's surgery.  A few minutes ago, my breast surgeons nurse called me and said "Dr. Romero asked me to call you and have you come in tomorrow so that he can review your slides with you before anything is done". So now of course now i'm like "what the hell is this about?". i'm going tomorrow at 3pm, of course i'll let you know what transpires. i know he had requested my slides from the lab that did them so that his hospitals lab could check it as a second opinion.  i'm just going with maybe thats just it, he just wants to explain this shit to me.  i don't know..all i do know is that you ladies said i can come on and vent and scream and whatever so that's what i'm doing.....I CAN'T TAKE THIS SHIT!  the waiting, the anxiety, the keeping my cool when i want to cuss, the sudden appointments. ever since this happened, i've kept a good attitude but i can feel the tension in my body...back aches, lazy, just want to stay home and sit at the computer or in the bed, moody (then again my period is coming one day soon). good thing about today was that one of the physicians assistants i met today i ended up crying on her shoulder, totally wasn't expecting that but she was wonderful! she was the perfect person to cry to because she ended up telling me she had breast cancer. i told her about you gals, my new best friends!

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2009 06:46PM Klawless9 wrote: yep today is definitely a take a deep breath day. i have a slight headache. so today i called my pcp and gave her the update on the need for a mastectomy. she wants me to get a second opinion and gave me a list of doc's to call. i called them and not one takes my shitty insurance (oxford/liberty).  i'll just have to close my eyes and pick one off the list of doc's that take it and i don't really like that idea. OR i say the hell with a second opinion and just keep this guy and keep it moving. i've been reading a lot and i keep seeing the need for a mastectomy if a woman has small breasts and the lump is behind or very close to the nipple, which is mine. So my current surgeon is right about that.  i looked up converting from mm to cm and on a path report i have from the first lab my size says 12mm x 13mm, so i figured that is 1.2cm x 1.3cm....that doesn't sound big does it?  Kendall

Posts.Content: Klawless9 wrote: Hi there i'm considering getting a second opinion but i have no idea of doctors to go to. I'm collecting names from folks and thought i'd see if anyone on here is from NY/LI and can suggest someone? and hopefully they take my insurance (united healthcare oxford/liberty), i checked my insurances website and naturally there are names up there (strangely enough, not one female name!) but its nothing like going to someone that someone else you know went to and liked.  my situation is that i've just been diagnosed with IDC. initially the surgeon said he'd make an incision above the nipple and take it out but now he's saying that since its definitely cancerous, its too close to the nipple and that i need a mastectomy. he said its small but for him to get good margins he'd want to take a good amount of tissue. I'm small breasted (barely an A cup) but he said he'd say the same thing to someone with big boobs. any info you can share will be GREATLY appreciated! Thanks!
